title: CampWiz NXT

home.welcome: A short welcome phrase like Welcome {{name}}. In this case, {{name}} is a placeholder for the user's name. If the user is not logged in, it will be empty.
home.subtitle: The translation of our slogan "Taking jury experience to another level"
home.publicRunningCampaigns: Anyone can participate in those campaigns which are public. This label would be shown in the home page
home.yourCampaigns: The campaigns that are asigned to you. Technically, you are either a jury, or co-ordinator of those campaigns. This label would be shown in the home page
home.dashboard: The dashboard where only admin or project leads can go to manage campaigns, This would be placed on a button so try to keep it short and one word
home.doc: The button for the link of documentation page

settings.title: Settings
settings.helpTranslation: A request for users to help translate the application to their language. This label would be shown in the home page. The <0>TranslateWiki is a link to the TranslateWiki website where users can contribute translations. Please keep <0>TranslateWiki as it is.
settings.translatewiki:
The Website Translatewiki where users can contribute translations for the application. This label would be shown in the home page. You can transliterate this to your language or keep it as it is.
For example, in Bengali, it can be transliterated as ট্রান্সলেটউইকি or kept as Translatewiki. So, for transliterated version, it would show as "অনুগ্রহপূর্বক আমাদেরকে ট্রান্সলেটউইকিতে আপনার ভাষায় অনুবাদ করতে সাহায্য করুন"

login.title: A proposal to Login
login.afterLoginRedirect: After this process, you will be redirected back to the following page:
login.loginDisclaimer: A legal statement. Here <0>Terms of Service and <1>Privacy Policy should be kept as it is and would be replaced with the corresponding link.

campaign.activeCampaigns: Heading for the list of the campaigns which are currently running.
campaign.archivedCampaigns: Heading for list of campaigns that were archived by the admin or project lead.
campaign.name: Label for the Name of the Campaign Field in the create campaign form.
campaign.startDate: Label for the 'Start Date' field for the campaign.
campaign.endDate: Label for the 'End Date' field for the campaign
campaign.coordinators:
Label for Campaign Coordinators
'''Coordinators''' are users who have access to a specific campaign and its round only. These users cannot create a new campaign or edit the current campaign, but they can create new rounds, delete a round, modify jury panel, download round results etc.
campaign.description: Label for the description of the campaign.
campaign.rules:
Rules, the thing that people must abide by for participating in this Campaign. Caption suitable for a page with a boring list of things that most people won't actually need.
{{Identical|Rule}}
campaign.publicVisibilityDisclaimer: A description for IsPublicJury Checkbox. If the checkbox is ticked, all the people (even logged-out users) can see the campaign in the list and join in the jury panel by clicking on a button.
campaign.privateCampaign: Campaigns that are not shown to the public.
campaign.wikiProject: Label for the field Wiki Project. It includes commons.wikimedia.org, bn.wikipedia.org, en.wikipedia.org etc.
campaign.duration: Label for the duration or timeline of the campaign. For example, June 1 - June 10
campaign.edit: A button to modify the campaign settings.

project.title:
A Project is a namespace which would periodically create campaigns. For example, the project responsible for organizing Wiki Loves Folklore 2024, Wiki Loves Folklore 2025 may be called as "Wiki Loves Folklore". Usually, projects are named as "Wiki Loves X" and the campaigns are named as "Wiki Loves X in 20XX" per year. But Exceptions, of course, applies.
{{Identical|Project}}
project.createProject: A Button to create a new Project. It should be brief and ideally one or two words.
project.goToProject: A Button to go to the dashboard of a corresponding project.
project.showAllProjects: A Button to show all the projects
project.projectLoading: A message indicating that project details are being loaded.
project.leads: Project lead is the person who manages all the things in a project including creating and editing campaign every year (or, multiple campaigns per year).
project.otherProjects: Projects that the user is not associated but can access by virtue of being an admin.
project.myProject: The Project that the current User is associated with. It would be shown in the project dashboard.
project.welcomeToProject: A gentle welcome to the {{project}}. Here {{project}} would be replaced with the name of the corresponding project.
project.editProject: Label of a button to edit the corresponding project.

round.addMyselfAsJury: In case of public campaigns, any user can join the jury panel by clicking on this button.
round.deleteRoundButton: Label for Deleting a round which would cause all the submissions and evaluations of the corresponding rounds to be deleted as well.
round.confirmChangeStatus: A confirmation message when user clicks any button to change the status of the round. Here {{status}} would be replaced with the target status (the status this round would get after this action is executed).
round.markAsComplete: A Label for the button to Mark the round as Completed. After this, coordinators can download the results and juries can no longer submit votes or modify votes.

status.PAUSED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round is not currrently running, but can be resumed
status.COMPLETED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round is completed and no further actions are needed
status.ARCHIVED: Status indicating that the campaign or the round has been archived or sealed and no other actions can be taken
status.IMPORTING: Status indicating that submissions (image/audio/video) are being imported into the campaign. This status is used when the campaign is created and the submissions are being imported from various sources like Wikimedia Commons, or other sources. This status is used to indicate that the campaign is not yet ready for evaluation and the submissions are being imported.
status.DISTRIBUTING: Status indicating that the submissions are being distributed to the juries for evaluation. This status is used when the campaign is created and the submissions are being distributed to the juries for evaluation. This status is used to indicate that the campaign is not yet ready for evaluation and the submissions are being distributed.
status.pausedThenCompleted: A Label for the button to Mark the round PAUSED at first (from ACTIVE status) then Completed. After this, coordinators can download the results and juries can no longer submit votes or modify votes.

round.submissions: The image, video, audio or any other type of file that is submitted by the participants of the campaign. This label would be shown in the home page
round.assignments: Each jury would be assigned a number of submissions to evaluate. This label would be shown in the home page
round.evaluatedOutOf: {{evaluated}} evaluated out of {{total}}. Here {{evaluated}} and {{total}} are placeholders for the number of evaluated submissions and the total number of submissions respectively. This label would be shown in the home page.
round.evaluationArea: A Button to go the page where the juries can evaluate the submissions. This label would be shown in the round page
round.categorizer: A Button to go the page where the juries can categorize the submissions. This label would be shown in the round page

type.label: Label for the type of the evaluation of this Round. This Type usually for the evaluation type such as Yes/No, Ranking or Rating
type.binary: Label for the Yes/No voting method in a round. Yes means the submission would get full score and pass this round. No means this submission would get 0 and might not pass the round.
type.ranking: Label for the ranking voting method in a round. In this type of round, multiple submissions would be presented to the jury and the jury would sort the submissions according to his/her consideration.
type.unknown: The Label for the unknown evaluation type of the round.

round.deadline:
'''This deadline is not enforced by the system, rather just shows on the screen'''
{{Identical|Deadline}}
round.deadLineInMonths_one: When the Deadline would come within 1 month.
round.deadLineInMonths_two: When the Deadline would come within 2 months.
round.deadLineInMonths_other: When the Deadline would come within {{count}} months. Here {{count}} would be replaced with the number of months and is greater than two (so, plural).
round.deadLineInWeeks_one: When the Deadline would come within a single week (7 days).
round.deadLineInWeeks_two: When the Deadline would come within two weeks (14 days).
round.deadLineInWeeks_other: When the Deadline would come within {{count}} weeks. Here {{count}} would be replaced with the number of weeks and is greater than two (so, plural).
round.deadLineInDays_one: When the Deadline would come within a single day (24 hours).
round.deadLineInDays_two: When the Deadline would come within two days (48 hours).
round.deadLineInDays_other: When the Deadline would come within {{count}} days. Here {{count}} would be replaced with the number of days and is greater than two (so, plural).
round.deadLineInHours_one: When the Deadline would come within a single hour (60 minutes)
round.deadLineInHours_two: When the Deadline would come within two hours (120 minutes)
round.deadLineInHours_other: When the Deadline would come within {{count}} hours. Here {{count}} would be replaced with the number of hours and is greater than two (so, plural).
round.deadLineInMinutes_one: When the Deadline would come within one minute.
round.deadLineInMinutes_two: When the Deadline would come within two minutes.
round.deadLineInMinutes_other: When the Deadline would come within {{count}} minutes. Here {{count}} would be replaced with the number of minutes and is greater than two (so, plural).
round.deadLinePassed: When the current time has passed the deadline.
round.quorum: The minimum number of jury votes required for each submission to be considered as evaluated properly. For example, if Quorum is 3, then each image must be voted by at least 3 different jury to be considered the round complete.
round.quorumRequired_one: When each image needs only one vote to be considered evaluated.
round.quorumRequired_two: When each image needs at least two votes from two different juries to be considered evaluated.
round.quorumRequired_other: {{count}} juries per submission are required. In this case, {{count}} would be greater than two (so, plural).

jury.title: Jury, people who will decide which photos are the best. Suitable as caption for a page talking about the local jury, presenting it, explaining how the best photos are selected or what kind of people will decide.
jury.totalAssigned: Label of the number of submissions were assigned the specific jury. {{count}} represents the number.
jury.evaluated: Label of the number of submissions the specific jury already evaluated or gave vote. {{count}} represents the number.

footer.campwizNxtTeam: Name of our Team who is behind this tool
footer.manual: The page where the user can find instructions on how to use the application. This label would be shown in the home page
footer.terms:
The text that links to the terms of service. Should not be capitalized.
{{Identical|Term}}
footer.reportBug: A label for the link to the bug report page. This label would be shown in the home page

privacy.title: Page title for the Privacy Policy page. {{Identical|Privacy Policy}}
privacy.effectiveDate: Label before the effective date of the privacy policy.
privacy.intro: Opening paragraph of the privacy policy explaining the page's purpose. Keep CampWiz NXT as-is.

infoWeCollect.title: Section heading for information collection in the privacy policy.
infoWeCollect.intro: Introductory text before listing collected information.
infoWeCollect.username: Description of collected data: the user's public Wikimedia username.
infoWeCollect.registrationDate: Description of collected data: when the user registered on Wikimedia.
infoWeCollect.ipAddress: Description of collected data: the user's public IP address.
infoWeCollect.outro: Explanation of why this information is collected and how it's used.

cookies.title: Section heading about cookie usage in the privacy policy.
cookies.intro: Introductory text before listing cookie purposes.
cookies.authentication: Explanation of authentication cookies (OAuth2.0). Technical term may be kept as-is.
cookies.authorization: Explanation of authorization cookies (JWT Token). Technical term may be kept as-is.
cookies.outro: Statement that cookies are not used for tracking or advertising. Keep not emphasis.

monitoring.title: Section heading about user activity monitoring.
monitoring.intro: Introductory text before listing monitored activities.
monitoring.campaignCreation: Activity monitored: when users create campaigns. {{Identical|Campaign creation}}
monitoring.projectCreation: Activity monitored: when users create projects.
monitoring.roundCreation: Activity monitored: when users create rounds.
monitoring.outro: Important clarification that jury evaluations are NOT monitored. Keep do not monitor emphasis.

errorMonitoring.title: Section heading about error tracking and performance monitoring.
errorMonitoring.intro: Explanation that Sentry is used for error tracking. Keep Sentry ™ as-is.
errorMonitoring.dataIntro: Introductory text before listing data sent to Sentry.
errorMonitoring.username: Data sent to Sentry: the user's Wikimedia username.
errorMonitoring.internalId: Data sent to Sentry: the user's internal CampWiz ID.
errorMonitoring.noIp: Clarification that IP addresses are NOT sent to Sentry. Keep does not emphasis.
errorMonitoring.learnMore: Link to Sentry's privacy policy. Keep <0>https://sentry.io/trust/privacy/ as-is (will be replaced with link markup).

dataSharing.title: Section heading about data sharing and retention policies.
dataSharing.noSell: Statement about not selling user data, with exception for submission results. Keep do not sell, share, or disclose emphasis and <0>good faith link markup.
dataSharing.internalUse: Statement that data is only used internally.
dataSharing.retention: Statement about how long data is retained.

yourRights.title: Section heading about user rights regarding their data.
yourRights.content: Explanation of user rights and contact information. Keep <0>support@wikilovesfolklore.org as-is (will be replaced with email link).

terms.title: Page title for the Terms of Service page. {{Identical|Terms of Service}}
terms.effectiveDate: Label before the effective date of the terms. {{Identical|Effective Date}}
terms.intro: Opening paragraph of the terms of service. Keep CampWiz NXT as-is.

eligibility.title: Section heading for eligibility requirements (numbered section 1).
eligibility.content: Explanation of who can use the platform (must have Wikimedia account).

acceptableUse.title: Section heading for acceptable use policy (numbered section 2).
acceptableUse.intro: Introductory text before listing prohibited activities.
acceptableUse.exploiting: Prohibited activity: exploiting bugs or vulnerabilities.

userData.title: Section heading about user data collection (numbered section 3).
userData.content: Explanation of what data is collected and reference to privacy policy. Keep <0>Privacy Policy as-is (will be replaced with link).

monitoring.title: Section heading about monitoring and abuse prevention (numbered section 4).
monitoring.intro: Introductory text before listing monitored activities.
monitoring.projectRound: Monitored activity: project and round creation.
monitoring.outro: Clarification that jury evaluations are not monitored.

serviceAvailability.title: Section heading about service availability (numbered section 5).
serviceAvailability.content: Statement that service availability is not guaranteed.

disclaimer.title: Section heading for legal disclaimer (numbered section 6).
disclaimer.content: Legal disclaimer about liability and warranties.

immunity.title: Section heading for immunity clause (numbered section 7).
immunity.content: Legal statement about immunity from liability for user actions.

changes.title: Section heading about changes to terms (numbered section 8).
changes.content: Statement that terms may be updated over time.

contact.title: Section heading for contact information (numbered section 9).
contact.content: Contact email for questions about terms. Keep <0>support@wikilovesfolklore.org as-is (will be replaced with email link).

error.noAssignedCampaigns: The error message that would be shown when the user has campaigns found in which the person is assigned as a jury or co-ordinator. This label would be shown in the home page
error.loadingSubmissionDetails: Could not load submission details: {{error}}. Here {{error}} is a placeholder for the error message. This error would be shown when submission details could not be fetched from the backend. This label would be shown in the submission details page
error.categoriesNotLoaded:
Categories are not loaded yet.
This error would be shown when the categories are not loaded yet in the categorization page. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.campaignNotFound: Campaign not found. This error would be shown when the campaign is not found in the backend. This label would be shown in the campaign page
error.campaignCategoriesNotSupported: Campaign categories are not supported. This error would be shown when the campaign does not support categories. This label would be shown in the campaign page
error.noSubmissionAvailableForCategorization: No submission available for categorization. This error would be shown when there are no submissions available for categorization. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noCategoriesSelected: No categories selected. This error would be shown when the user tries to save the submission without selecting any categories. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noCategoriesAvailable: No categories available. This error would be shown when there are no categories available for selection. This label would be shown in the categorization page
error.noSubmissions: No submissions available. This error would be shown when there are no submissions available for evaluation or categorization. This label would be shown in the evaluation page
error.noRunningCampaigns: A Phrase when no campaigns are running
error.loadingMyProject: An error message indicating that the project associated with the current logged in user could not be loaded due to some error.
error.loadingProjects: An error message indicating the failure to load the list of projects
error.accessDeniedToProject: Error Message if the User does not have access to this project
error.failedToFetchProject: An error message indicating that the project associated with the current logged in user could not be loaded due to some error.
error.failedToFetchCampaign: An error message indicating that the corresponding campaign details could not be loaded due to some error.
error.failedToFetchRound: An error message indicating that the corresponding round details could not be loaded due to some error.

close:
{{Identical|Close}}
Label for a generic close button. For example, the user can click on the close to close a modal or a dialog box

modifytable.name: Label for the name of the submission.
modifytable.preview: Label for a button in the modify table that allows the user to preview the submission. For example, the user can click on the preview to see the submission
modifytable.action: Label for list of Action the user can take on this assignment. For example, the user can click on the preview to see the submission, or click on the edit to change the score of the submission

evaluation.skip: Label for a button that allows the user to skip the submission. For example, the user can click on the skip to skip the submission and go to the next submission
evaluation.edit: Label for a button that allows the user to modify vote or score of the submission. For example, the user can click on the edit to change the score of the submission
evaluation.yes: Label for a button that allows the user to accept the submission. For example, the user can click on the yes to accept the submission
evaluation.no: Label for a button that allows the user to reject the submission. For example, the user can click on the no to reject the submission

submission.title: Title of the submission
submission.author: {{Identical|Author}}
submission.viewOnCommons: Link to view the file on Commons. The whole phrase is linked.

languages.en: English (English). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is English, it should be "<Translation of the name English in your language> (English)"
languages.bn: Bengali (বাংলা). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Bengali, it should be "<Translation of the name Bengali in your language> (বাংলা)"
languages.ar: Arabic (العربية). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Arabic, it should be "<Translation of the name Arabic in your language> (العربية)"
languages.hi: Hindi (हिन्दी). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Hindi, it should be "<Translation of the name Hindi in your language> (हिन्दी)"
languages.es: Spanish (Español). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Spanish, it should be "<Translation of the name Spanish in your language> (Español)"
languages.fr: French (Français). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is French, it should be "<Translation of the name French in your language> (Français)"
languages.de: German (Deutsch). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is German, it should be "<Translation of the name German in your language> (Deutsch)"
languages.it: Italian (Italiano). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Italian, it should be "<Translation of the name Italian in your language> (Italiano)"
languages.ja: Japanese (日本語). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Japanese, it should be "<Translation of the name Japanese in your language> (日本語)"
languages.ko: Korean (한국어). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Korean, it should be "<Translation of the name Korean in your language> (한국어)"
languages.pt: Portuguese (Português). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Portuguese, it should be "<Translation of the name Portuguese in your language> (Português)"
languages.ru: Russian (Русский). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Russian, it should be "<Translation of the name Russian in your language> (Русский)"
languages.zh: Chinese (中文). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Chinese, it should be "<Translation of the name Chinese in your language> (中文)"
languages.kn: Kannada (ಕನ್ನಡ). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Kannada, it should be "<Translation of the name Kannada in your language> (ಕನ್ನಡ)"
languages.mr: Marathi (मराठी). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Marathi, it should be "<Translation of the name Marathi in your language> (मराठी)"
languages.ta: Tamil (தமிழ்). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Tamil, it should be "<Translation of the name Tamil in your language> (தமிழ்)"
languages.ml: Malayalam (മലയാളം). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Malayalam, it should be "<Translation of the name Malayalam in your language> (മലയാളം)"
languages.ur: Urdu (اردو). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Urdu, it should be "<Translation of the name Urdu in your language> (اردو)"
languages.gu: Gujarati (ગુજરાતી). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Gujarati, it should be "<Translation of the name Gujarati in your language> (ગુજરાતી)"
languages.pa: Punjabi (ਪੰਜਾਬੀ). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Punjabi, it should be "<Translation of the name Punjabi in your language> (ਪੰਜਾਬੀ)"

For example, if the language is Luxembourgish, it should be "<Translation of the name Luxembourgish in your language> (Lëtzebuergesch)"
languages.zh-hans: For Simple Chinese. Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. languages.tr: Turkish (Türkçe). Please keep the language name in your language and then add "(<Original language name in that language alphabet>)" at the end of the name. For example, if the language is Turkish, it should be "<Translation of the name Turkish in your language> (Türkçe)"
